fields.description:
Custom actions are not working since upgrading from 3.2.6 to 3.3.8

No error, no dialog appears just nothing
fields.summary: Can't assign keystroke to custom actions in 3.3.8

fields.description:
I've defined a Global Ignore List at Tools > Options > Git, but files which should be ignored are still in the "Unstaged files" section.

These files are never committed before nor tracked.

 

This affects version *3.3.8* which isn't listed at the "Affects Version/s*" section when creating a ticket.
fields.summary: Global Ignore List does not work.

fields.description: The current "dark" theme does not match any other dark theme dev tools - it's fine to include as a "blue" theme and some people may prefer it, but since the app now has theme support, can we please have a proper "black" dark theme that matches in with other dev tools
fields.summary: Black Dark Theme (rather than Blue)

fields.description: When using dark theme, shortcut menu items are not visible when renaming a branch
fields.summary: dark theme=> to be improved

fields.description: Prueba
fields.summary: Prueba

fields.description:
Sourcetree commit is not responding - every time it asks for credentials and then does nothing after. 

Version in use is 3.3.8 Sourcetree for Windows.
fields.summary: Sourcetree Commit is Not Responding

fields.description:
Currently if the most recent commit is later than the checked out commit, it appears with a circle lower in the history list. It would be useful if there was an option that placed the head of the current checked out branch at the top of the list.

 

!image-2020-05-08-16-14-18-246.png!
fields.summary: In history view, move the current branch so that it is at the top

fields.description:
If authentication fails connecting to a server. Don't f***ng try it three more times.

This locks the account.
fields.summary: Authentication failure - Keeps attempting to authenticate on single request.

fields.description:
Running SourceTreeSetup-3.3.8.exe on Window7

(seems like version 3.3.8 but belowin this form I selected the highest possible)

First step, "Registration", press the "Bitbucket" button.

Default web browser (Firefox) opens on: [http://localhost:34106/?state=authenticated&code=TuCBZajAtRrHeS4m5Z] with page "Authentication Successful", "you can close this page"

But the installer won't enable the "Next" button, so installtion is stuck
fields.summary: sourcetree intallation stuck at "Authentication Successful"

fields.description:
Applies to v3.3.8
I had a case where P4Merge was called to resolve a conflict in a too large .js file and it hung in the background. It seemed like nothing had happened so I attempted to resolve again, but got a warning that attempting to use P4Merge on such a large file could cause P4Merge to hang. I opted to not launch the external merge tool. Not having a clear picture what was in my local file, I committed the changes. Also, the file status filter was set to "Modified" so I didn't notice the untracked conflict files. 

There are multiple areas for improvement here. 
1. Detect when external merge tool fails to release conflict files and provide a warning
2. Check for presence of unresolved merge conflict files, esp. for recent conflict resolution attempts
3. Make "unstaged changes" more visible
fields.summary: Allowed to commit/push with unresolved conflict

fields.description:
Many apps now have the ability to automatically switch between dark and light themes when the setting is changed by the user or a script at specific times.

Add option to Sync theme with OS

On Windows just need to monitor this registry key for changes: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Themes\Personalize
Value Name: AppsUseLightTheme
fields.summary: Sync theme with OS

fields.description: When Sourctree is in full windowed mode you can't reach the teaskbar if you set it to autohide, you need to minimise it for the taskbar to appear.
fields.summary: No access to taskbar in full windowed mode

fields.description:
Everytime i try to install Sourcetree i get a "source tree stopped working" error.

fields.description:
Hi,

 

First, i loved the dark theme, but for production the Light Theme is better since there is a better contrast on the notifications.

If it's possible, I would suggest for you guys to change the dark blue color in the dark themed for a more light one to make more contrast and be perceived by human eyes.

 

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Dark theme Contrast at Commit/Pull/Push Bar Notifications

fields.description:
In 'File Status' view, with tree view selected and 'all files' , if you select 'sorted by filename' or 'sorted by path'  (i think they do the same thing when tree view is selected), then the files are correctly sorted.

However if you remove focus from SourceTree, and then give the focus back to SourceTree, this seems to cause a refresh of the File Status view, and the sort order is now incorrect.  The top level of tree is still correct - but any subfolders seem to be reverse sorted by file/folder name with the files and folders mixed together.

*Found in version 3.3.8 (but i can't select that version below)*
fields.summary: File Status - Tree View - Sort order lost on refresh

fields.description:
Hello,

I am using SourceTree for a project which contains large text files I've configured to be handled by LFS.

I have enabled the settings {{git config diff.lfs.textconv cat}} to allow diffing from the Git Bash, which works.

Also, using an external diff tool in SourceTree allows me to look at the changes in those large files.

Unfortunately, the history diff preview panel shows the diffs between the file pointers rather than the file contents (as it would happen with {{git diff}} if {{diff.lfs.textconf}} were not set).

It's inconvenient to have to switch to an external diff tool for each changed file.

Am I missing a setting, or is full content diff going to be implemented at some point?
fields.summary: Honour the 'git config diff.lfs.textconv cat' settings

fields.description:
After clicking "Repository > Branch...", entering the name of the branch, and clicking [Create Branch], the new branch is created locally but nothing is created on the server.

Afterwards, if I click "Repository > Push..." the branch name appears on the left under "Local Branch" but a corresponding name is not available for selection on the right under "Remote Branch".  If I then go to the web site and manually create the branch, I can then come back to SourceTree and do a "Repository > Refresh".  Then, when I open the "Push" dialog, I now can select that branch under "Remote Branch", click the "Track" option, and complete the push.

I believe this is a defect as I know I previously didn't have to go create the remote branch manually using the web interface. I am currently using v3.3.8 Windows but that version does not appear in the drop-down list; I selected the highest available version.  I had been using v3.2.6 but the update to 3.3.8 didn't improve things.  I also updated the embedded git from 2.18 to 2.21 but no change in behavior.
fields.summary: Creating new branch does not create branch on remote

fields.description: After update Sourcetree to newest version (3.3.8) some repositories are not visible.
fields.summary: Repositories not visible

fields.description: A quick google search shows someone already posted this error as long as 2013 but no action at all was taken. Why? I find that this persistent message makes no sense at all. After I commit and push, all my work is done. "Uncommitted changes" will just appear. Can someone try to fix this? It's very confusing to me as a beginner as it makes me think some work is incomplete. I can't paste my screenshot as there's no attachment facility. Again, I'm using 3.2.8.
fields.summary: Bad design: Uncommitted changes appear for no reason

fields.description:
After spending time checking how sourcetree sends Unity projects, I sent a few projects to make sure it worked consistently. There were 2 cases where only 4 folders were sent. I don't know why other folders were not sent. I had issues where new scripts modified by Unity and sourcetree also were not detected as new or modified. I suspected that perhaps sourcetree  files were not working properly. I removed , then reinstalled and tested it again. When I tried again, more folders were sent and this time, it looked more like the folders I see on my computer. The folders sent earlier were :
 * Assets
 * Library
 * packages
 * ProjectSettings.

Can someone check if sourcetree is corrupted? I only used the latest version. I'm unsure why the category doesn't have 3.3.8 but I inserted another version so I can post this.
fields.summary: Folders not properly posted, new scripts not consistently detected

fields.description: I tried sourcetree 3 months ago and found that the manuals were strictly for mac users. Recently I was in the Unity forum and opened a thread to discuss free version control apps. Many suggestions were given but when I checked all of them, I found out that only 2 free unlimited ones were available - this one - sourcetree, and github desktop. After spending a week with github desktop and posting questions, I was told in another forum that github desktop cannot handle complex branching issues. Upon being forced to return to sourcetree, I found the same problem - no proper manuals for windows users. Whilst I have carefully played around and found how to use it, including how to configure sourcetree properly, I wish to ask the management why this persistent laziness exist so small time users like me have to waste more time playing around to learn how it works? Is this standard practise at the higher levels of the company?
fields.summary: No proper manuals for Windows

fields.description:
We were using sourcetree and it was working fine , and after the update we are getting the below error . [taramasamy@globusmedical.com|mailto:taramasamy@globusmedical.com] and tamizhthangam is the user id .

!image-2020-04-23-18-33-06-213.png!
fields.summary: Failed to check Login for user
adding helperselector to config

fields.description:
This used to work, but stopped working quite some time ago (probably more than a year).

1) Make changes to project. These can be staged or unstaged – doesn't matter.
2) Choose Create Patch from the Actions menu.
3) The Working Copy Changes tab is selected.
4) Attempt to click Stage Selected, Stage All, or click the the - icon.
5) The dialog redraws, but the file is not moved to the dialog's Staged files list and the Create Patch button remains dimmed. Note that the - icon does change to +.

Expected behavior:

Files move from the Unstaged files list to the Staged files list and the Create Patch button is enabled whenever there are Staged files listed.

Affected version: 3.3.4. It was not in the list so I could not select it.
fields.summary: REGRESSION: Cannot create patch from working copy

fields.description: Please bring back the repository view window!  I am stuck on version 1.9.5.0 because the change to only a "tab" view is terrible!!!!  It is so nice to see all your repos and see if any need updated before working.  With the new layout you have to switch through all your tabs to make sure you are working with the latest deliveries.
fields.summary: Repository quick view

fields.description:
When you delete repositories from the bookmarks *one by one* the list of repositories gets accumulated if you select the «Delete from disk» option.

!image-2020-04-22-12-05-36-789.png!
fields.summary: Remove repositories dialog accumulates repository names incorrectly

fields.description:
Creating pull requests through Sourcetree is super buggy.

When I right-click on a branch and select Pull Request, it tells me that I "...don't have any remotes which have extended integration settings configured". So, I go into repository settings and specify an endpoint. Great.

Then, when I go back and right-click on the branch and select Pull Request, it shows an error dialog that says, "Unable to open your web browser to '', do you have a default web browser set?" 

I've forgotten how I've worked around this in the past, but it usually involves purchasing a new office window and monitor. Later, when I reopen Sourcetree after closing or restart, everything gets wiped and I have to repeat the above steps all over again.

This is beyond frustrating. Please fix this!!

This affects version 3.3.8.
fields.summary: https://bitbucket.org/aiqbankinc/tht-so-inc/raw/cdfd00c1dc80080926954fa09e506a711ac6698c/README.md

fields.description:
After switching to SSH this error appears.  !image-2020-04-18-18-36-34-500.png!

Pull and PUSH to Bitbucket using SSH is working, so why the remote error ?
h3. SourceTree 3.3.8 [20 Jan 2020]
fields.summary: Remote Exclamation Mark although PULL and PUSH work

fields.description:
When you try to resolve conflicts, SourceTree creates the temp files correctly, but doesn't not start Beyond Compare 4 any more. This was working.

I can start beyond compare successfully from the command line using the created temp files, therefore this is a SourceTreee regression bug.

I'm using SourceTree version 3.3.8
fields.summary: Diff/Merge Fails with Beyond Compare 4

fields.description:
I get an error when I try to clone with source tree. The Error is:

Unexpected character encountered while parsing value: T.Path Line 0, position 0.

 

I tried  upgrading to the latest version of sourcetree, with no change in the error.

 

I can log in to BitBucket via the web, but when I try via Sourcetree I Get the error shown above. I get the same error when I try to refresh the password.

 SourceTree Version 3.3.8
fields.summary: Authentication failed on BitBucket account in sourcetree

fields.description:
Steps to recreate:

Open a Bitbucket repo and click checkout to sourcetree.

Checkout in URL actions window.

Crash occurs

 

This occurs in version 3.3.8 but there is no option to select, so the latest was selected.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when checking out branch in browser.

fields.description:
Installed SourceTree 3.3.8 on a fresh Win10 1909 OS.

SourceTree does not appear on Start Menu.

SourceTree does not appear in "Recently Added" list in Start Menu.

 

*N. B.: This refers to version 3.3.8. On "Create Issue" form, the most recent version listed is 3.2.2.*
fields.summary: SourceTree does not appear in Win10 Start Menu

fields.description:
Creating pull requests through Sourcetree is super buggy.

When I right-click on a branch and select Pull Request, it tells me that I "...don't have any remotes which have extended integration settings configured". So, I go into repository settings and specify an endpoint. Great.

Then, when I go back and right-click on the branch and select Pull Request, it shows an error dialog that says, "Unable to open your web browser to '', do you have a default web browser set?" 

I've forgotten how I've worked around this in the past, but it usually involves purchasing a new office window and monitor. Later, when I reopen Sourcetree after closing or restart, everything gets wiped and I have to repeat the above steps all over again.

This is beyond frustrating. Please fix this!!

This affects version 3.3.8.
fields.summary: Sourcetree v3.3.8 is forgetting extended integration settings

fields.description:
When i click the GitHub account on the left of the screen, it lists all the Remote Repos for me on the right with a filter text box option on the top of this list. When i try to write any part of the repos name / or even the exact name, it does not filter the list below.

 

*i am using 3.3.8 version of the windows application*
fields.summary: Remote Repos Filter not working

fields.description:
I have multiple repositories on my harddrive and saved in Sourcetree, but not all are opened at the same time. I organized those repository in multiple folders inside Sourcetree.

When I try to open a repository with the "+" tab, browse through my Sourcetree folder structure, right-click a repository to open its context menu and click on "open", it opens a different repository. Double-clicking on a repository instead of opening the context menu will open the correct repository in a new tab.

 

_Note: My installed version of Sourcetree says 3.3.6 but I can't select that as "Affected Version"._
fields.summary: Opening a saved repository from context menu opens a different repository

fields.description: When setting the taskbar to autohide, sourcetree is the only application that when maximised prevents the taskbar from showing  when moving my mouse to the bottom of the screen.
fields.summary: When sourcetree is maximised it interferes with the taskbar

fields.description:
Please ADD Affects Version/sRequireds id with 3.3.8 - it is  version what you provide to download on start page ! 

Running Windows 7 64 bit and Windows 10 64 bit.

All fresh new install. Try to install sourcetree 3.8.8

Get login form to bitbucket. Open it in browser (Firefox or change to Chrome, try one and another), accept all permission, what form asking, and  installation stuck.

If antivirus software are running - than form not opened in browser, but when it is stooped it shows successful windows. Any way it not helps you to continues installation.


[link to community post with images|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Can-t-install-sourcetree-3-8-8-on-Win-7-64-bit-and-Win-10-64-bit/qaq-p/1335045]
fields.summary: Can't install sourcetree 3.3.8 on Win 7 64 bit and Win 10 64 bit

fields.description:
I have several repositories cloned from Bitbucket server in sourcetree.

After I restart sourcetree the Remote button has a Red question mark. ANd I am not able to push any changes to the Bitbucket server

When I go to the repository settings and to the Remote repository path in de screen "Remote details" the Remote Account is set to "Generic account".

!image-2020-03-31-14-45-44-394.png!

When I switch to my personal account I can push changes again.

But after restarten sourcetree it switches back to the "Generic Account" again and then I need to switch to my personal account again.

 

We are working with 3.3.8.
fields.summary: Each restart of sourcetree resets the account in repository settings

fields.description:
After staging files (all or selected), the Staging files dialogs "Close" button is highlighted, suggesting that it has focus. However, pressing enter does not close the "Staging files" window, but actually activates the "Commit" button of the main window. The "Staging files" windows stays open.

If, before pressing enter, I activate another application and then move back to SourceTree, the enter key works as expected.

 

Using version 3.3.8 which is not present in the affects versions list
fields.summary: After staging, close button does not respont to enter key

fields.description:
Please note: I am currently using SourceTree v3.3.7. This is not an available option under 'Affects Version/s' so I selected 3.2.2.

I use Source Tree by creating several different folders each folder has several repositories.

A few versions back, sorry I don't know which version (around October 2019?), after an update I opened SourceTree and all my bookmarks had been lost.

I figured it was due to an incompatibility between versions so I went through the task of restoring all of my current bookmarks.

Now, on a regular basis, when I open SourceTree a large number of bookmarks will be lost. There does not seem to be anything consistent with how this happens but I am monitoring this more closely and will report back if I can replicate the issue with some sort of regularity.
fields.summary: Bookmarks regularly lost

fields.description:
*Precondition:* 

*1)* open application "Укрзалізниця"

*2)* select any menu item

*3)* rotate the screen horizontally

*Expected results:* ** if the application logic should show the user's current tickets, then you need to go to the "Мои билеты" menu, where the list of available tickets for the user is located

*Actual results:* at horizontal position of the screen produces text: "У вас нет актуальных билетов" "Поверните ваше устройство вертикально для работы с приложением"**
fields.summary: incorrect recording when rotating the screen

fields.description:
Having updated the software recently to Sourcetree v3.3.8, I am facing some issues while checking-out and cloning repositories into my local machine.

The check-out button stays greyed-out and does not show any matching repository on the local machine, while the cloning new option causes the software to crash. The software crash occurs after repo cloning to an empty folder is completed.

Sourcetree v3.2.6 with same data on the machine works just fine. I couldn't find a description of a similar issue on the platform, if there is, kindly link it with that. Otherwise, a resolution would be handy! 

P.S. I couldn't find v3.3.8 as affected version so, I have just selected the most recent version.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Sourcetree v3.3.8 issue while check-out and cloning

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a repo with some members containing copyright signs (©).

In the diff pane of the main Sourcetree window, they appear as <black diamond with ?>

File encoding: ISO8859-1 (also in ST options)
Character code: 0xA9
Fonts tried : Source Code Pro, IBM Plex Mono

Both these fonts have 0xA9 mapped; the character appears correctly in other applications such as Beyond Compare, Notepad++.

To replicate, create a new file in a repo with ISO8859-1 encoding, containing a single copyright sign. Review in ST, diff window

Please note, form does not accept my current version: 3.3.6.3829

 

Thanks! Stay safe! Brent
fields.summary: Display problems of "unusual" characters in main window diff pane

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Checking out a branch from Bitbucket Cloud UI will freeze SourceTree WIN 3.3.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a repository in Bitbucket Cloud UI
# Click on Branches
# Choose a branch
# Click on "Check out in SourceTree"

h3. Expected Results
# I would be able to choose, whether if I'd like to check out the branch using HTTPS or SSH

h3. Actual Results
# By default it wants to checkout the branch using SSH, when I click on "close", I get a "BugSplat" error screen and SourceTree crashes
 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Checking out a branch from Bitbucket Cloud UI will freeze SourceTree WIN 3.3.8

fields.description:
Hello, I'm trying to install Sourcetree for Windows. 
When I install the software, I'm asked to register via my Bitbucket account. I click the button and grant access, and even get the "Authentication Successful" message in my browser.

However, that's where things stop. My installer never gives me the option to go to "Next"

 

The installer is for version 3.3.8 which isn't even listed on this form.
fields.summary: Cannot get past "Registration" step of installer

fields.description: I installed SourceTree3.3.8 version and it installed successfully however when I try to look for the sourceTree on in the search bar in windows 10. It does not show up. The application shows up in control panel for uninstallation however I do not see anyway to start sourcetree application
fields.summary: Unable to Start SourceTree

fields.description:
When trying to review changes on attached file, one CPU thread maxes out and the UI freezes for about 5 minutes.

Could this be related to the comparison code trying to parse the .xml structure of the file due to the extension?
fields.summary: Severe performance problem trying to review changes in text file with extension .xml

fields.description:
On registration step, after selecting bitbucket button and opening a new tab with the message:
h2. Authentication Successful

SourceTree has been successfully authenticated. You may now close this page.

 

The instalation client 3.3.8 dosen't goes forward and NEXT button is disabled. So I can't install sourceTree.
fields.summary: Instalation failure

fields.description:
I downloaded Sourcetree but the program does not appear to save on my computer.  Every time that I want to run the program I have to find the exe file in my downloads and run that.  It also does not communicate properly with my companies Stash server.

I have tried re-downloading Sourcetree but that did not change anything.
fields.summary: Unable to save sourcetree to computer

fields.description:
NB: This is in version 3.38, but that version does not show up in the list of versions!

I set up credentials for Bitbucket Server so I can create pull requests. Everything works fine until I exit Sourcetree. When I restart Sourcetree, my remote account integration settings are lost and I can no longer create a pull request. Likewise for "View repository online".

I am using a "saved account". That is still present after a restart, but it is no longer assigned to the remote repo.

The behavior is very similar to SRCTREEWIN-8293, but this happens even when I am connected to the host repo network when SourceTree starts, so the root cause may be different.
fields.summary: Optional extended integration settings disappear on restart of SourceTree

fields.description:
STEPS:
 # select a file
 # right-click and open in Log window
 # select a revision
 # right-click and "Open Selected Version"
 # observe nothing happens

EXPECTED

The selected revision opens in my default editor for the given file extension, or at least an error message is displayed.

 

NOTES

This occurs in Version 3.3.8 as well as 3.1.X.  Version 3.3 is not available from the Versions list for Jira.

I am testing this with a ".cs" file. In windows the associated app is Notepad++ (I have tried others).  If I double-click a .cs file in file explorer, it correctly opens it in the selected editor.

The process viewer does correctly show a "ExportFileAtCommit" entry.
fields.summary: Open Selected Version does nothing, even though extension is registered with Windows

fields.description:
Using sourcetree 3.3.8. Select a file in unstaged files area, perform an external diff, perform a change to the file and save it. In my case, i used winmerge, which creates a .bak file after saving. When closing the external merge tool, you can see the additional .bak file appear in the unstaged area. Now, right click and press _*Remove*_ on the .bak file. In the dialog that appears now, you will see 2 files to be deleted which is incorrect.

!image-2020-03-10-20-13-11-739.png|width=537,height=205!
fields.summary: Source tree wrongly includes files when deleting file in unstaged files region

fields.description:
After installation during registration stage opening up localhost:34106 for authentication.

Sourcetree cannot be used with the bug.

 
{code:java}
ERROR [2020-03-10 11:06:38,327] [13] [Sourcetree.Analytics.Emau.EMauSubmissionService] [Log] - POST MAU submission FAILED

System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'TimeZoneConverter, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. The located assembly's manifest definition does not match the assembly reference. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131040)
File name: 'TimeZoneConverter, Version=2.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'
 at Atlassian.AnalyticsService.Client.Converters.IanaTimezoneConverter.WriteJson(JsonWriter writer, Object value, JsonSerializer serializer)
 at Newtonsoft.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerInternalWriter.SerializeConvertable(JsonWriter writer, JsonConverter converter, Object value, JsonContract contract, JsonContainerContract collectionContract, JsonProperty containerProperty)
 at Newtonsoft.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerInternalWriter.SerializeObject(JsonWriter writer, Object value, JsonObjectContract contract, JsonProperty member, JsonContainerContract collectionContract, JsonProperty containerProperty)
 at Newtonsoft.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerInternalWriter.SerializeObject(JsonWriter writer, Object value, JsonObjectContract contract, JsonProperty member, JsonContainerContract collectionContract, JsonProperty containerProperty)
 at Newtonsoft.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerInternalWriter.Serialize(JsonWriter jsonWriter, Object value, Type objectType)
 at Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializer.SerializeInternal(JsonWriter jsonWriter, Object value, Type objectType)
 at Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.SerializeObjectInternal(Object value, Type type, JsonSerializer jsonSerializer)
 at Sourcetree.Analytics.Emau.EMauSubmissionService.<SubmitBatch>d__61.MoveNext()
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot Load TimeZoneConverter when Linking Bitbucket Account

fields.description:
The button to open the console doesn't do anything besides flashing when I click on it. It used to work fine but for a couple of weeks now it doesn't work anymore.

!image-2020-03-09-15-18-14-820.png!

!image-2020-03-09-15-19-30-408.png!
fields.summary: Open console button doesn't work

fields.description:
Hello,

If you ignore the silly requirement to have a Bitbucket account for simply using the source tree software, source tree refuses to allow anyone to specify an install folder, so you're forced to use AppData or whatever silly folder they've decided we have to use. After my installation it crashed and instead of a nice message telling me, I was presented with a dump file and no explanation.

 

Why can't an option be given to set the location and provide useful feedback on install failure?

Honestly I uninstalled it and went to Git Cola (hint: it took 20 seconds download, install and run) because it also looks like the source tree installer wants to mess around with my git configuration and installation.

 

Just provide a simple installer or a zip with no forced login, an ability to state location and doing nothing other than just installing the software.
fields.summary: Failure to install and also failure to set install location

fields.description:
I download the "SourceTreeSetup-3.3.8.exe" installer, when i want to login to my Bitbucket account it send me to this URL http://localhost:34106/?state=authenticated&code=GvCTtY99b8aNPYG82j.

Obviusly, never does it.
fields.summary: When click in Bitbucket login open an Localhost URL
Unable to use Sourcetree and downlod repository on second machine

fields.description:
SourceTree *v3.3.8* for Windows - cannot push a branch that isn't "master". 

See attached screenshot: https://pasteboard.co/IXw5liO.png

Clearly I have one commit to push on my own branch, yet both the Push button and the Push right-click menu has listed only the master branch, with no way to add my own branch on the dialogue.

For now I am pushing my commits directly from Visual Studio.
fields.summary: Cannot push branch other than "master"

fields.description: I've been alternating among several multi-repo projects. It would be great if one can save their current status (active repos), set up a new set, work on them for a while, and eventually be able easily return to the previous session.
fields.summary: Add a "session" paradigm with save/restore

fields.description:
When being prompted in "Registration" to login I am just bounced back to the same view again and unable to press the button. In my browser is an unresponsive page after granting access:

[http://localhost:34106/?state=authenticated&code=[code]]

 

Installer: SourceTreeSetup-3.3.8
fields.summary: Unable to login when installing

fields.description:
Files encoded with UTF-16 LE (little endian) without BOM (Byte Order Mark) does not display correctly. Every other character is displayed as a space (see screenshot).

To reproduce:
 # Save a text file as "sample.txt" in a git repository with encoding of UTF-16LE (without BOM)
 ## To do this I use the SublimeText3 "Save with encoding" feature
 # Add the line
{code:java}
**/*sample.txt text working-tree-encoding=UTF-16LE{code}
to the ".gitattributes" file which should let Git understand how to interpret the file. (this should make it show up correctly)
 # Look at the file in the diff view in source tree (see screenshot)

Screenshot:

!image-2020-03-02-09-04-20-243.png!

To verify fix:
 # make sure that the diff view now works with files that are encoded with BOTH of the following encodings:
 ## UTF-16 LE (without BOM)
 ## UTF-16 LE BOM (WITH BOM)
fields.summary: Diff not working on UTF-16 LE files without BOM

fields.description: latest version of sourcetree consume more then 80% resource of CPU while in inactive
fields.summary: Consume CPU More then 80%

fields.description:
Sourcetree win 3.3.6 on windows 10

Bitbucket server 5.3.1

 

Clone - remote repositories works well for all repos in projects except projects that the name begins with a period (ie. .NET)
fields.summary: Clone Remote Repositories against Bitbucket Server does not find repos in projects whose name beings with period

fields.description:
Sourcetree versions after 3.1.3 are using a different web api to retrieve the list of remote repositories from a Bitbucket Server remote. These new api's do not return the list of repositories correctly.

I'm unsure if this is a bug in Sourcetree (using bad api calls), or if its a bug in Bitbucket Server (does correctly implement new api's).
fields.summary: Newer Sourcetree versions use different API when gathering remote repositories from BitBucket Server

fields.description:
Any chance of better tabs? I am thinking maybe mutliple lines, or tabs on the left side of the screen with search. We have a lot of projects it can be quite difficult seeing which ones need pulling. Even a global pull button (or one you could configure to pull the ones you want) or even be able to group them?

 

Your product is awesome!
fields.summary: Better Tabs

fields.description: Sourcetree for Mac supports adding keyboard shortcuts for custom actions. It would be incredibly useful to add this for windows as well.
fields.summary: Add shortcuts for custom actions in Windows

fields.description: File status updates automatically.  So if I change a file and then switch back to Sourcetree the file status section updates.  However, if I pull commits from the repository or make a commit locally the branch history auto-update doesn't happen.  Also, with "Current branch" selected, if I switch branches outside of Sourcetree the branch history auto-update doesn't execute.  The only way to get branch history to update in these scenarios is to switch from "Current branch" to "All branches" or vice versa.
fields.summary: Git branch history does not update unless forced

fields.description:
Hi,

Since 3.3.8, I cant force push. I've got the box that's checked off.

And source tree don't refresh local directory.

 

Thank you.

----------

Win 10

Source tree v.3.3.8
fields.summary: Failed to force push

fields.description:
I can double click the desired branch but the UI does not bold the name and put the circle in front of the name like it used to do. I can open Bash in the repo and see the branch has changed. I must manually refresh the screen and it will then show the current branch as expected.

 

I am running  3.3.6.3829 but the 'Affects Version/s' does not have the version listed , stops at 3.2.2, so there is another issue to resolve.
fields.summary: UI does not reflect current branch after changing

fields.description:
I just updated {color:#FF0000}*sourcetree to 3.3.8* {color}and there's a major bug that has forced me to uninstall and go back to my previous version (3.2.6). {color:#FF0000}*The same thing happens in 3.3.6*{color}

+{color:#0747a6}*(there's no 3.3.8/3.3.6 option in the version field of the issue, so I had to put 3.2.4)*{color}+

I have different window's directories with basically the same project on different branches.

Until version 3.2.6, if I had a tab with *repo1::project1* opened and tried to open *repo2::project1* in another tab (same project, in another branch in a different windows directory), It'd let me.

Now, every time I try to open the second one, It goes back to my *repo1:project1* tab, so I cant have both opened at the same time.
fields.summary: Cant open two tabs with same name in different repositories

fields.description: When click on stage selected/stage all and unstage selected/unstage all moving files to respective block but its doesn't show in respective block. Its shows in respective block when we close and open the app again.
fields.summary: stage and unstage not moving file to respective block

fields.description:
I recently built a new PC, downloaded all my favourite apps for productivity including Sourcetree... 

Downloaded 3.3.8 from the sourcetreeapp.com website as usual, When running I see the blue splash screen followed by a few seconds delay and then sourcetree loads. I've never seen the actual installation menu

I cannot find the application when searching in Windows Search, Does not show up in Control Panel etc

%AppData% shows various folders with JSON and XML configs in them.

 

Version 3.3.8 Does not exist in the lower "Affected version" box.
fields.summary: Sourcetree 3.3.8 doesn't install

fields.description:
The diff embedded in SourceTree isn't showing tabs correctly when "show invisibles" is enabled.

The correct way to show tabs in this situation is to show a single "invisible" where the tab is, then indent as much as you need for a single tab, then (if there's a second tab) show another invisible and indent again, etc.

Currently instead it shows all the invisibles at the beginning of the line, and the invisible dots in apparently arbitrary places.

Since I've noticed that also the dots for the spaces are all messed up, I guess that whenever there are tabs, all of the invisibles do not show correctly.

_(for some reason I found no way to attach screenshots for now, I'll try to add them as links later)_

_(also for some reason it doesn't allow me to select version 3.3.8, which is the one I'm using - on Windows 10)_
fields.summary: Diff isn't showing tabs correctly if "show invisibles" is enabled

fields.description:
it is now going ahead from Bit bucket login step for installation on windows 7 machine with latest version

 

please guide me for the same
fields.summary: Not able to install sourcetree in my windows

fields.description:
When I updated to the latest version of sourcetree for windows (3.3.7), I have to refresh in order to see any changes (switching branches, merging, new commits, etc.).

 

Please fix this issue. It makes it very difficult to use.

 

PS: version 3.3.7 is not listed below.
fields.summary: Version 3.3.7 for Windows forced to refresh for every action

fields.description: With expected max level of grain humidity of 50% the calculator accepts the meaning of 50.90%, which exceeds the limit
fields.summary: Error in max allowed humidity percentage

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open [https://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]
 # Select an arbitrary value in the delivery base
 # Choose an arbitrary culture
 # Enter a humidity indicator between 50 and 100%

Expected result:

      "Введіть показник вологості менше 50%"

Actual result

     "Введіть показник вологості у %"

 

!image-2020-02-15-14-43-06-299.png|width=313,height=63!
fields.summary: Error in the input field when the humidity indicator is from 50 to 100%

fields.description:
When I try to install SourceTree (using SourceTreeSetup-3.3.8.exe), Windows Defender claims it is an unrecognized app (although it recognizes the Publisher, 'Atlassian Pty Ltd).

 

I'm on Windows 10 Enterprise, Version 10.0.17763 Build 17763. I selected 3.2.2 as the affected version, however the installer exe suggests the latest release version (the one I'm trying to install) is 3.3.8.

 

!image-2020-02-13-16-01-03-035.png!
fields.summary: Windows Defender SmartScreen prevented an unrecognized app from starting

fields.description:
I created a simple text file in my local repository - textfile1.txt. It shows up in Sourcetree unstaged files as textfile1.txt.txt. I have deleted and recreated it several times, and it always looks the same. The file always has the correct name in Windows Explorer. Then when I stage it, the file name in Sourcetree remains textfile1.txt.txt.

 

Note: I'm using version 3.3.8, but that version doesn't show up in the "version" drop-down.
fields.summary: Unstaged file shows 2 extensions

fields.description:
Version:3.2.6 (please update Jira when you release a new version)

Log selected does not seem to work, but in fact it works.

Please make sure the window pops up on top of the main window.

I have a dual monitor setup, maybe that is the reason.

But after Alt-M and selecting the active source tree application from the task bar I see only one window grouped in the windows taskbar (the main application).

However when I cycle to the next column in the taskbar I see there is a second sourcetree icon which contains a group of sourcetree windows and these are all small log windows I had tried to open before.

1) please make a single group of source tree windows on the taskbar so it is clear there are multiple windows active.

2) have the window popup in front of you when you choose "Log Selected".
fields.summary: Log selected does not popup window but opens in background, seems not working.

fields.description:
I have a Main repository using 19 submodules.

In the submodules tabs everything works as expected: When I commit, the entire vie is automatically updated.

In the main repository this is not the case. After every stage, commit, fetch, pull etc I manually have to hit F5 to refresh the view.

 

The option "Refresh automatically when files changed" is enabled.

The option "Refresh when window is not focused" is enabled.
fields.summary: When using Submodules the main repository view is not updated automatically

fields.description: Hi there, today I'm recommending your products to my customers and work together with them. I'm software developer, my environment is Linux (Ubuntu). Unfortunately the only thing that I feel you missing is about Sourcetree for Linux. Alternatively I'm using Gitkraken. No one of my customers are using Windows, rarely they use Mac, because we work in Brazil and Mac is totally unaffordable here ($$). Backing to the goal, Gitkraken is alone in Linux environment. Would be great if you'd bring Sourcetree to Linux too (specially to Ubuntu). Thank you.
fields.summary: Sourcetree for Linux

fields.description: When I switch branch or do other actions on the fiirst opened repository, I have to manually hit F5 to refresh it. Other tabs automaticly refresh.
fields.summary: Automatic refresh breaks on the first repository tab

fields.description:
I've configured Sourcetree to use a remote repository (Bitbucket) under *Settings*. Under *Optional extended integration*, I've selected my *<username>/Bitbucket Server* as the remote account. However, every time I close Sourcetree and reopen, the *Remote* button has a red exclamation mark overlay icon, and the *Remote Account* under *Optional extended integration* has switched back to *Generic Account/Generic Host*.

I've tried this on versions 3.3.6 and 3.3.8 and in both versions it switches back to Generic Account. The last version where this was working correctly was 3.2.6.

Please fix ASAP. 

I can't find version 3.3.6 or 3.3.8 in the Affects Version/s drop-down list in this bug report, but it's a mandatory field, so I selected the first version in the list. Please ignore.
fields.summary: Sourcetree switches back to Generic Account on optional extended integration

fields.description:
I think that in former versions of SourcTree the program stored the opened 'trees' under BRANCHES, TAGS, REMOTES, ... what was nice.

Now I would appreciate to have at least an option that the tree to the currently checked out branch is opened, when starting the program or opening a new or stored repository tab.
h2. What it looks now

!image-2020-02-12-19-14-03-171.png!
h2. What it should look like

  !image-2020-02-12-19-13-31-438.png!
fields.summary: Open tree to checked out branch

fields.description:
When clicking on stage all, or commit, or branch or merge, the sourctree GUI does not respond to the action. i.e. files do not show as staged, commit doesn't show as having occured, and history is not updated. If you close sourcetree and reopen it, then the changes or commands issued are reflected.

!image-2020-02-11-14-19-39-526.png!

 

!image-2020-02-11-14-20-40-790.png!

 

!image-2020-02-11-14-17-46-269.png!
fields.summary: Sourcetree GUI does not keep sync with staging, commits, branches, merges

fields.description:
On Log/History view, if you are working with too many branches, tracing what has been changed on which branch is sometimes quite mess even using the graph view.

If the graph view would provide a new feature that, when any branch/commit is clicked on the history list, that branch where the commit is done would be highlighted with a thicker line, that would be very useful. 

Graph view is useless if so many branches are created from one branch, because the lines get mixed up. See below picture as an example:
!image-2020-02-11-12-35-04-816.png|width=526,height=258!
fields.summary: Highlighting single branch on graph view

fields.description: Even after adding the correct public and private keys. Appreciate your help here
fields.summary: Not detecting the SSH keys and the application closes abruptly

fields.description:
I have tried deleting all folder regarding source tree and do re-installs - no luck

When I try to install it says Authentication Successful - but the next button does not become enabled so install cannot continue. What to do ?
fields.summary: Cannot install - Authentication Successful - No next button

fields.description:
This is happening to quite a few people on our team. While on Sourcetree 3.1.3, users can see repositories that they have permissions to in the remote tab. When they update to the latest version of Sourcetree (3.3.6), all repositories stop showing up in the remote tab.

 

We were able to get the user's remote repositories (on 3.3.6) to show up by giving them read permissions to a different project. Both the repos from project A and B now showed up. This seems like a bug with Sourcetree. Has anyone found a solution to this?
fields.summary: Sourcetree Repos not showing up in remote tab

fields.description: In SourceTree 3.3.6 (there is no version in Affects Version for 3.3.6 FYI) on Windows 10, both in the New Tab page or in the Local repositories popup under the hamburger menu on the right, Show In Explorer is always disabled for every repository. Actions > Show In Explorer and the Explorer button both work.
fields.summary: Show In Explorer Context Menu Always Disabled

fields.description: {color:#FF0000}*SCT v3.3.8*{color}. If I try to checkout a branch with Bitbucket (v4.3.0)  using "..." near branch name SCT is opening a dialog for checkout. After click button checkout SCT crashes and display the crash report dialog (I send sevceral times the crashreport).
fields.summary: crash on checkout by Bitbucket

fields.description: after a fresch installation {color:#FF0000}*v3.3.8*{color} (delete AppData\Local\Atlasian and AppData\Local\Sourcetree completely) SCT does not save remote login data for bitbucket. Will see a red exclamation on button "Remote". After clearing this problem by edit url (Remote account) in settings the red exclamation disappear and I can work. Than after close and reopen SCT the red exclamation will displayed again ad the users remote accout is set to "Generic Account / Generic Host"
fields.summary: not saving remote login data

fields.description:
The last Version in Jira for SourceTree for Windows is 3.2.2.

There are other fields that are messy as well.
fields.summary: Affected versions for SourceTree for Windows are not up-to-date in Jira

fields.description:
The Check for Update features currently tells me, that my version 3.3.6.38229 is the latest version, which is incorrect, because I can manually download 3.3.8 from the [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/] website.

 

I have noticed this issue in the past. Eventually it will find a new version, but only every couple of weeks/months.

 

If a new version is available, I want to be notified.
fields.summary: Auto Update/Check For Updates updates only after many weeks/months

fields.description:
Using Sourcetree 3.3.7 on Windows.

1. Go to New Tab > Local repositories.

2. Use search to find a repository.

3. Right click on the repository and select delete.

4. Confirmation will be prompted.

5. In the confirmation, there are more than the repository that being selected
 * it includes other repository
 * it includes the other folder (that contains repositories)

6. Ok and it will delete as per the list and lost all the repositories

 

*Application does not delete repository as per selected but randomly includes other repository. almost like the search, ruin the indexing and delete random thing.
fields.summary: Repository does not get deleted as per selected in Local Repositories after filtering
Provide an option in Rename Branch Dialogue to force Rename (ie git branch -M)

fields.description:
If I use the GitFlow and click on Finish Feature the FeatureName (Branchname) is displayed but only for a few seconds. On the dropdown arrow I see a rotating donut. 10 seconds later the there is now more feature name in the dropdown box, no more rotating donut. And the OK button is disabled.

So I can only Finish the Feature (merge) if I'm fast enough. 

 

-> Its in Version 3.3.6 but its not possible to choose in Affects Version
fields.summary: Finish Feature loosing Feature Name

fields.description:
Hey guys,  I'd like to ask you fix this problem.

Everytime I have opened SourceTree (version *3.3.8* - I'm not able to check it in your list of versions) I had warning on my remote icon.
!image-2020-02-07-07-48-17-218.png!

 

I setup it correctly (with my account),  but everytime I've open sourcetree, warning is there and my default remote user is setup to generic account
!image-2020-02-07-07-49-28-463.png!
fields.summary: Remote connection problem

fields.description:
Configuration for use with gerrit requires modifying a repos origin push to :

refs/heads/*:refs/for/*.

this worked great with 3.1.3 and earlier versions.  Now, we just get a push window with absolutely NO branches or anything so it is impossible to push changes unless auto-pushing using the checkmark to push directly upon committing.  This is ok in normal scenarios, but as soon as you enter complex scenarios like wishing to ammend a checked-out commit that someone else has pending in gerrit, which requires creating a local branch, we normally have to manually tell it to push it to the correct refs/for/correctBranch.  this is now impossible.  See screenshots that I will add as comments to the issue to see the 3.1.3 behaviour and the latest behaviour (same in all versions more recent than 3.1.3)

Please correct this, it forces our teams to remain on 3.1.3 just to function.
fields.summary: Sourcetree for windows DOES NOT WORK for ALL VERSIONS after 3.1.3 with gerrit repositories.
